snippet: Gov. Chris Christie’s State of the State address on Tuesday comes days after his last turn at the podium, when he accepted responsibility for his staff’s role in closing traffic lanes on the George Washington Bridge.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie’s State of the State address comes days after his last turn at the podium, when he accepted responsibility for his staff’s role in closing traffic lanes on the George Washington Bridge; will try to refocus attention from controversy over vindictive traffic jam to the day-to-day work of governing, by outlining plans to extend the school day, lower taxes for homeowners and reduce urban crime.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie’s State of the State address on Tuesday comes days after his last turn at the podium, when he accepted responsibility for his staff’s role in closing traffic lanes on the George Washington Bridge.

headline.main: Governor Hopes Speech Will Obscure a Scandal
headline.print_headline: Governor Hopes Speech Will Obscure a Scandal
